page.title: 05THE BOAT MUSEUM
page.content:
The Boat Museum was founded for the preservation of canal boats, their artefacts and folklore. It was opened on 12th. June 1976 in the basin of the Shropshire Union Canal. Today the museum employs 80 people, 50 of whome are part_time and has many volunteers. Full time staff work an 8 hour day, and last year showed 85,000 visitors around the site. Of these, 25,000 were school children. Work on restoring the site and exhibits still goes on. Each year about three boats are restored,and they are now restoring "Mendip". Old buildings such as the Pump House, Toll House and Island Warehouse have been restored.
.
